title: Service Document
description: The By-Reference document allows the client to send a list of one or more files that the server will fetch asynchronously.

@context.title: The JSON-LD Context for this document

@type.title: JSON-LD identifier for the document type
@type.description: This field is used to define the type of the document, and in this case should always be 'ByReference'.  MUST be present.

byReferenceFiles.title: List of files to deposit By-Reference
byReferenceFiles.description: MUST be present and contain one or more entries

@id.title: The URL of the file to be retrieved and deposited

contentType.title: The Content-Type of the file to be retrieved and deposited

contentLength.title: Content-Length as it would have been supplied if this were a regular file deposit.

contentDisposition.title: Content-Disposition as it would have been supplied if this were a regular file deposit.

packaging.title: The packaging format of the file, or the Binary file identifier
packaging.description: SHOULD be present.  If this is not provided, the server MUST assume this is the Binary format: http://purl.org/net/sword/3.0/package/Binary

digest.title: Digest as it would have been supplied if this were a regular file deposit.

ttl.title: A timestamp which indicates when the file will no longer be available (Time To Live).
ttl.description: MUST be formatted as UTC big-endian date as per {{ ref('NOTE-datetime') }}. If no date is provided, the server MAY assume the file will be available indefinitely.

dereference.title: Should the server dereference the file (i.e. download it and store it locally) or should it simply maintain a link to the external resource.
dereference.description: MUST be present.  Note that servers MAY choose to do both, irrespective of the value here, though if `false`, the server should make the external link available to users accessing the resource.
